text: Well when you said that though uh, m- my my new boss, she came. She told Mike yesterday-, she's I wanna be there at seven o'clock to go to community meeting. And so she went into the community afterwards, she's, it hasn't been a good morning she says, I bought four five pairs of new pants, before I left, and had em shortened. speaker: 43_ANNE
text: She's doing okay. They said her voice probably won't be back to normal, ever I mean, but, she called Jenny. For Jenny this afternoon.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Her wisdom teeth and her voice.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I mean not her wisdom teeth, her tonsils.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh. I was gonna say, man, I never knew the wisdom teeth.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Didn't do anything for your voice...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: You just talk as much as you used to.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: But, so we sent Amy flowers. Or my-. They go, Annette call, and order some flowers. Call em, how much do you wanna spend. I don't know. I don't care. I said what's what can you get a nice bouquet. Twenty twenty-five. Sure. It's not my money.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh it comes out of the fund.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I don't know where it comes out of, they just charge us.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh. Man I, uh I was supposed to leave money for Lettie's going away present. In an envelope there. And, uh, I was asking Anne what we were going to get her, for her new office. She decorates her home and her office, l- by Chinese. And I thought this was really strange, cause she's Hispanic. You know. And and all y-. When we went to her house, all the oriental things. And I says what sh- Lettie needs, is plant- uh. Cause she loves plants, but they die on her. And in her office, if I wouldn't water em and take care of em, she wouldn't have had any plants.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: God...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: So I says, what about a nice, either silk plant, or one of the silk trees, that would sit behind her desk then. You know.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Mhm.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: I says that's very soothing, when she's doing therapy and stuff. And Anne says, that's a good idea. And I says you know, Costco has some real reasonable ones...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Or you can, uh, silk warehouse for some of em. And she's, I think that's a good idea, and then she can, her real, other decorating she can do as she wants and prefers...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah. Where's her office, where's. Did she move. Or is she still here.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well, no she's th-. She's just going in with some of the doctors into private practice though.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Mm.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And do counseling. It'll be.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh is she gonna be at the hospital though.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: No.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Mm.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: She's just moving up front to the front offices.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh. Well so you'll still see her and stuff.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: You know the the one doctor, who lost his wife this summer...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: When they were on vacation.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: She's gonna take over her practice...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Cause their their therapy styles, are quite similar.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And uh, you know, all these patients w-. Since the death was so sudden, all these patients were just kinda left on a.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And so she's been illing in quite a bit.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Hm... Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And that just kinda made her final decision, cause she said when she graduated from grad school, that's what she wanted to do, in five years have her own practice. And she said but that's scary to do.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And she says, so the opportunity, the patients are there. So it was a perfect opportunity.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: It helps. Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Even though the circumstances are not the best... <XX> <XX> private practice.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Hm. Mhm... When uh we sent Amy flowers, cause she's staying with her mom now. Cause she has to be watched.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh. Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: And so we go, we don't know if we should send em to Tony, or to Amy. Because, Amy and Tony, they fight like cats and dogs anyway. And then when you're not feeling well, and, you know, and Amy just flo- goes off the handle, cause Tony's no-. You know no-. Bugging and nosy and...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: And I'm like I don't know who we'd wanna send flowers to, cause they're both gonna drive each other crazy...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well you're not the most pleasant person when you're sick.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I n-. No one is. That's the thing.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: But they don't get along, I mean, that well.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well you just don't listen to me. I'm the nurse, and I tell you.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I always listen to you.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Annette you do not.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Do too.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Do not.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Just.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Take your medicine...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Do this.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: That's the way Jenny went home today sick, and I said you go buy some orange juice, I said take some liquids, I said I don't want you going out at all this weekend...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: What did she say. Thank you mother.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: She goes I'm not. Oh I said I don't wanna see you out...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: One of the little kids came up to me and he said...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: I got something to tell you Alice. And I said what. He said, I bit both sides of my tongue. And so he sticks his tongue out and shows me, I said well don't do that anymore. And he says and it hurts like heck, and I said well don't do that anymore.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: What a dipshit...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And this one little kid who's been, really having a problem. The other day, he was tracking so well. And I says well, I says in the morning then, if you track really well, let me know, and I'll s-. We'll. I'll get the sa- tr-. I'll save that tracking sheet, and give it to you. You can have it then. And you can show your parents when they come in. He was so excited, the next morning, I barely walked on the unit and he, he's screaming, Alice Alice. He says guess what, I tracked good all day long, then I forgot to turn it in. So he still stayed on level three.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Uh...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Poor kid.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mm. So I says...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And. But he was okay with that. But he says I know I did really good, and I says, I know you did too, and you can do good today, so he did really good to-. Today also...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: But he was the little kid, the other day before his mother came to visit. Physically worked himself up into such a state, that he threw up, three times, before she came.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Was he excited to see her, or didn't wanna see her.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well this is the new stepmother...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And he's really excited, but he's uh. He's just such a hyper kid, when he gets involved in that, couldn't believe it. Mm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Wa...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Do you have a bunch of homework and stuff to do tomorrow. Well that'll be good, if Diane and I are out of here.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah. I mean I don't have a lot, cause actually this week in my, methods course it's pretty mellow, but I finally got a hold of Bishop Kelly, they finally called me back.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: About what.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Someone there. My observation I have to do there. I have to do twenty hour-.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh you are gonna do it.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Not my student teaching, my observation. Totally different.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well, who sets that up. You or.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Well you-. They- you just set it up through the, education department, they have to call and approve you to gi-.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I mean they have to say, you know, s- I have five students coming, these are the names, so you aren't just having these weirdos coming and saying, I'm supposed to observe your school.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: You know. And so finally Doctor DeLiando called me back today. I called Wednesday, and yesterday, and then he called me back, he called me this morning but I wasn't in yet. So.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: So when do you start that.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I go in Tuesday. To meet him. And to get it set up then.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Hm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: So, <XX>.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: How do you say his name.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: DeLiando.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: I don't think that's how you.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh, that's what they told me.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh, okay. I didn't think that's how you pronounced a good old Basque name but...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <XX>, Well that's what I've b-. I mean that's.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah. So then are you j-... uh Do you observe different teachers... uh Or one teacher.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I can pick. He goes, I'll introduce you to em, and he goes, and then you can pick and-. Pick which ones you want then...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: You should sit in in Miss Brown's, and some of those, I wonder if she's still.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Those aren't English.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh you have to do English...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Hunh, hm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I don't know any of the English teachers now. But, I, I'll probably. I mean you get bored doing it, I mean and they want you to... uh If you can help, you know, maybe grade paper or.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mhm, hm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Do something, but it's also a lot of work for the teacher, to find something that a s-.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: That you can do just being there, an hour a week, or two hours a week.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: So th-, sometimes you can't. But sometimes you get bored, I mean I. Watching the same class for twenty hours, that's boring. Just sitting there.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: So I mean if you can get involved, it. It helps you, plus.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: It also helps pass the time, but, so I told Mickey, I'm like Mickey, I'm gonna be in late... uh Tuesday she's like, Annette, I don't care. You just make your own schedule anyway, you just come and go as you please, I don't care. Well I asked Cathlene I said...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Right after we got off the phone, I said I'd be there at seven forty-five. Doctor DeLiando I said, oh yeah, Cathlene I said, since you're the one in charge today I said, I'm gonna be in late Tuesday. Is that okay. And she's like yeah. Okay... <XX> <XX>, that's a little bit, she's just leave me a sticky so I know.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: And then I go, I'll leave a sticky on Tony's, so she thinks that, you know, we include her in things. I told Mickey, Mickey's like, I don't care.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Uh What does. Does. Chris teach teach there...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Uh, last I heard she did. That was last year but.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Wouldn't it be funny if she taught English, and you got to sit in.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: She teaches biology.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well I know.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Mom.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Rats.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: You just don't know what's going on at that school anymore.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well I didn't know.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: That's sad about that kid in the paper. Who, who's in the coma, he was a, the star f- baseball player at BK. And he got that scholarship. To, he was what a Gatorade player of the year, two years ago, and then he w-.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: But I thought it was his dad who was...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: In the hospital.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: No, it's him. He's in a coma.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh. Okay.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: He got hit by that drunk driver. And his younger brother. Plays at BK and has a football game. And I g-. It wa- the pa- the- article was about, you know, how, they're all gonna g-. All the family's gonna go to the game today, because, sports are very important, in this family you know.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: And they all used to go watch, the older brother play baseball, and that's what he would want, is their family to be at the game and.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Um.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Really.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: The coach, I think it's Tim Lincoln, or.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah. Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: One of the Lincolns, said, you know, if you don't wanna play, that's fine, if you d- don't wanna. If you g- have to come out of a play, you just do whatever. But it was like, gosh.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well that's like, there's a lot of pressure on this football team.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah cause.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Because Nick.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Osetty's son is.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Mhm.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: I mean it's his dad, who's the field is dedicated to.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And he wants to dedicate his senior year to the- his dad, in memory of his dad, cause he was a star player.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah, so.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And they play Kuna, and isn't th- always that your homecoming.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: No, cause we usually lose to Kuna, so I think we had to p-...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: We always played like Payette, that we like beat every year.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: For like seventeen years, and then I think, our senior year, junior or senior year, we lost to em.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And they beat you.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: It was like, Oh God...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: But, the only reason I went to the game was just to figure out what was going on afterwards, so it didn't really matter.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: I know.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Well I never knew. I didn't. I could never even tell you half the players on the. Yeah, you play football. Mm I knew the ones that.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mattered.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah. I went to a couple of the JV games, you know what I'm saying. Louis's game- team lost, Wednesday though. So they're two and.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mhm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Five and two now. They've only lost two games. They lost to Centennial the other day.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well I thought maybe...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: That's what he was doing last night. Cause when we came by the stadiu-. Uh the pavilion... the football field. At BSU, the lights were on.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Well the seniors play, they have uh... uh They have game in-. The varsity has games Thursday and Friday.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Oh. Okay.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Cause they can't always get all the games in. Especially when it s- gets dark this early now.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: They have to have a lot more games, and then most of the schools don't have fields you can play at, in Boise.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Don't have lights, no. But there sure were-.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: So.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: There- uh weren't a lot of people there.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh yeah. Probably.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: But that was, seven o'clock, I don't know what time the game started.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Ah, just kind of. Their games usually start at seven.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: On Wednesdays.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mhm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: But varsity.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah. I don't know.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Varsity probably starts at seven.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Maybe it's an eight o'clock. Seven, seven thirty.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: There weren't, a whole lot of.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah, might have been.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mhm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: They were probably may- maybe playing an out-of-town team, too.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And I know dad said, yeah I don't know why they have the lights on yet, because it still was really light out.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah. Well they have to get em on, so they can.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Get it going...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And I thought maybe that was. I thought maybe it was the sophomores.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <XX>.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Well I thought Louis's game was at four forty-five, I know they have one afternoon game, but it's next Wednesday I found out. And so I was gonna go and watch his game after work, you know, I get off work right at five.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mhm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Then go, go to work at <XX> and then, then he had a game at seven, and I was like oh. And then my legs hurt, I couldn't have walked anywhere, anyway. That was a weird thing.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Mhm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah cause Diane came in today, and she goes what's wrong with your legs. Mom and dad were freaking out about it. And I said it was, it was freaky.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well that's how come I called in the morning...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: You know, cause I didn't wanna go in and wake you up and say, how are your legs Annette and.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: It's like, how the hell do you think they are...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: My legs are fine, but, I'm tired.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: But I need some more sleep. And then, so then, I remem- uh. Luckily I remembered, to call early enough. Otherwise I was gonna call you at work.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah... <XX>.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: But then I thought, that'd be kinda stupid, I call you at work, and if you didn't go to work they'll say, no, she's home sick today and, kinda like, what kinda mother are you. You live in the same house.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Well, They know th-. I mean, that we have different schedules and stuff...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Hm.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: But yeah they're. Like I said they're s-. They're still kinda sore, like achy kinda sore, but they're, I mean they're, I can walk and everything.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: I think it's more of a flu.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: They aren't so, That's what I think it was though.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Bug.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Yeah cause I didn't have an appetite, or anything else like that, and I think that's part of it, I mean.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: Well, you could.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: I have to be sick to, not eat. Now I've made up for it though. Today everything looked good. I was like, oh. Cause Jenny and I had to go over to the store and get the punch, and, um, cups and stuff, for the open house. Today and, I mean, everything looked good at the store. And she was sick. So nothing looked good to her...

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: And I was like, That looks good, doesn't that look good. No, no.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: That was like yesterday, after I got my car fixed. G- I went and took it in for, you know the, maintenance thing...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And it was a free one.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: That's what you told me. Yeah.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: And uh, then dad wanted to go get that oil. For the fans. To oil, put on the fans. I said well you go do that, and I'll go to the grocery store. And I was hungry then. Cause this was three o'clock, and I had breakfast at eight o'clock yesterday. Man, everything looked good. So a hundred dollars later...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: I walked out of the grocery store, and then we went last night.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh to get stuff for the soup.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: For dad. Yeah.

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: Oh, gee.

speaker: 43_ALIC
text: For hunting...

speaker: 43_ANNE
text: <NONVERBAL>
